outputs.output_descr: ECONOMIC EMPOWERMENT OF DEPRIVED FAMILIES IN JERUSALEM THROUGH PROVIDING MICRO ENTERPRISES TO REACH 300 DEPRIVED FAMILIES THROUGH BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT GRANTS TO ESTABLISH INCOME GENERATING PROJECTS TO GRADUATE FAMILIES FROM POVERTY

1 Sustainable CSOs engagement in East Jerusalem under the umbrella of a solid pilot Programme in the city enhanced
2. The capacities of the CSOs in EJ as knowledge providers and active strategizing agents developed.
3. Synergies and  dialogues among CSOs and other stakeholders established.
Enhanced access to effective social, economic and public services and utilities in East Jerusalem
DEVELOP & SUPPORT AROUND 150 SMALL ENTERPRISES IN  JERUSALEM THROUGH GRANTS & MICROFINANCE and including around 300 families in these small enterprises.
Enhanced access to effective social, economic and public services and utilities

In line with the Palestinian Authority's Development Plan (PNDP) in supporting the housing sector, UNDP is currently implementing the first phase of housing rehabilitation for around 60 deteriorated homes in East Jerusalem owned by low-income and poor families using the self-help modality with a total of USD 3 million, funded by the Islamic Development Bank.

UNDP aims to expand the current support by targeting a new housing package for an additional 60 housing units to reach out to a larger number of needy and marginalized families suffering from severe housing conditions, which may end up forcing them to leave or sell their houses under the imposed status quo.

project_descr: JERUSALEM DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMME IS TO DEVELOPE THE CAPACITY OF JERUSALEM CIVIL SOCIETY ORGANIZATIONS, REHABILITATION OF HOUSES, ECONOMIC EMPOWERMENT, LAND PROTECTION, & SUPPORT TO SMALL BUSINESSES AND ENTERPRISES
